item.description:
Report E-2023050046

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-25T12:15:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-04-03
  • City: Ludington
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: HIGHWAY TRANSPORT CHEMICAL, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 1
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Employee was transferring chemical from cargo tank to customer storage tank via air-offloading using approximately 10 PSI. A few minutes into transfer, employee thought that product was not flowing as it should and began trouble shooting the unloading system. While doing so, employee failed to bleed the pressure from chemical hose prior to disconnecting hose resulting in spill and chemical exposure to employee's lower face, mouth, tongue and left ear. Employee utilized on site safety shower and was later transported to local hospital for evaluation and treatment. Employee was later admitted for observation only.

item.title: Report E-2023040502
item.description:
Report E-2023040502

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-25T12:15:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-03-23
  • City: Detroit
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ACV ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Team member was offloading a 25 yard vacuum box from the roll-off truck, and when it was fully tipped up on the rails, it started to leak. The material was chromium contaminated liquid / sludge, and liquid started to leak out of the top of the vacuum box door through the top seal (approximately 30 gallons total). They were able to get the box on the ground and the leaking stopped. The binder chains the secure the door were stuck inside the door, compromising the seal/gasket at the top of the door. After investigation, it was determined that the container had been delivered to the customer that way, and had been filled that way. It did not initially leak during loading because the material was mostly sludge. During transport, the solids settled, leaving more liquid on the top of the box. The material that leaked was cleaned up internally as it was at a TSDF with a response crew. The spill occurred inside of a containment area, and did not require further environmental reporting.

item.title: Report E-2023040132
item.description:
Report E-2023040132

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-25T12:15:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-03-28
  • City: ROMULUS
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: First Call Environmental was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 6ft-by-6ft area of the concrete terminal floor and estimated that two (2) quarts of material was released. First Call Environmental personnel stated that terminal personnel deployed Soda Ash prior to the contractor’s arrival and further stated that the 55-gallon poly drum had been damaged by a strap in the dock area First Call Environmental personnel deployed Citric Acid to neutralize the impacted area and used granular absorbents to collect the material. The spent absorbents and debris were placed into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum and was staged onsite at the terminal prior to the contractor demobilization. The damaged drum was overpacked into one 95-gallon poly drum. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XPN experienced a release of UN1263 "2K 2.1 VOC Speed Clearcoat" from a 55-gallon metal drum due to a forklift puncture. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 15-gallons of product released to a 10' x 20' area of the concrete lot below the trailer and approximately 5-gallons released to a 3' x 3' area of the trailer floor. The release occurred due to a forklift puncture. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted areas. The damaged drum was containerized into a 95-gallon metal overpack. All cleanup debris was containerized into (3) 55-gallon metal drums. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: Young's Environmental was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 24ft-by-36ft area of the terminal dock floor and estimated that one hundred and fifty (150) gallons of material was released. The remaining material in the damaged tote was transferred to a new poly tote and staged onsite. Young's Environmental personnel used granular absorbents to collect the material and cleaned the impacted area with Simple Green. The spent absorbents and debris were placed into seven (7) 55- gallon metal drum, the cut up tote was placed into one (1) 55-gallon metal drum and an impacted pallet was cut up and placed into one (1) additional 55-gallon metal drum. The drums were staged onsite at the terminal prior to the contractor demobilizing.

item.title: Report I-2023020003
item.description:
Report I-2023020003

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-24T21:07:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-01-09
  • City: NILES
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CO-ALLIANACE COOPERATIVE,INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 2
  • Description: CO-ALLIANCE VEHICLE WAS TRAVELING EAST ON US 12 (4-LANE HIGHWAY W/MEDIAN) IN THE RIGHT LANE. MARATHON VEHICLE WAS TRAVELING WEST ON US 12 IN THE RIGHT LANE. CO-ALLIANCE DRIVER HAD A MEDICAL EVENT AND LEFT THE EAST BOUNDS LANES DRIVING INTO THE MEDIAN AND INTO THE WEST BOUND LANES OF US 12 UNTIL STRIKING THE MARATHON VEHICLE HEAD ON. BOTH DRIVERS WERE DECEASED AS A RESULT OF THE CRASH. THE CO-ALLIANCE VEHICLE WAS A MC 331 PROPANE DELIVERY STRAIGHT TRUCK. AT IMPACT, THE TANK BROKE FREE FROM THE CHASSIS. THE HOSE WAS RIPPED FROM THE SYSTEM AND RELEASED APPROXIMATELY 100 LBS. OF PROPANE. ALL OTHER SAFETY DEVICES ON THE CARGO TANK FUNCTIONED PROPERLY. THE HOSE RELEASE WAS LESS THAN 30 MINUTES. MC 331 CARGO TANK SUFFERED A SIGNIFICANT DENT, BUT THE CARGO TANK DID NOT LEAK OR FAIL. CO-ALLIANCE HAS TAKEN THE TANK OUT-OF-SERVICE AND IS DONATING THE CARGO TANK TO THE AREA FIRE DEPARTMENTS FOR A TRAINING MODULE. GENERAL VEHICLE FLUIDS WERE CLEANED USING ABSORBANT PADS AND LOOSE ABSORBANTS. NO FIRE OR EXPLOSION.

  • Description: On January 24, 2023 at approximately 01 :13 a.m., a Brenner Oil Company unit (tractor/trailer) left the pavement due to icy conditions while traveling northbound on US 131. In the course of incident, the tractor disconnected from the tanker trailer and left the tractor upright while the tanker trailer came to rest on its side in a low-lying area to the east of the unpaved shoulder area. The accident and rollover of the tanker trailer resulted in the release of 5,157 gallons of unleaded gasoline from several damaged compartments onto the unpaved areas within the highway right-of-way (ROW) to the east of US 131 NB. Numerous fire departments, the Michigan State Police (MSP), the Michigan Department of Transportation (MOOT), and Brenner personnel responded to the incident. GFL Environmental (formerly Northern A-1) provided environmental incident response and mobilized to minimize the spread of spilled gasoline, place sorbents, etc. The fuel remaining in the tanker trailer was pumped into another vehicle and properly transported away. Soil excavation activities began on January 24, 2023, with contaminated soils temporarily stockpiled nearby until appropriate off-site disposal could be arranged. Surface water run-off and potentially impacted groundwater is being removed and staged in frac tanks, pending analytical results, after which proper management will occur. Excavated soils are being transported to the Central Sanitary Landfill in Pierson, Michigan, and excavated areas are being backfilled with clean fill. The environmental response work is being overseen by personnel from the Michigan Department of Environmental, Great Lakes, and Energy (EGLE) and is currently ongoing.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: BOX STARTED SMOKING TRAVELING DOWN THE CONVYOR BELT, ONCE NOTICED IT WAS PUT IN A HAZMAT TOTE AND SET OUTSIDE FOR VENTILATION. FEDEX EMERGANCY NUMBER WAS CALLED FOR OUTSIDE INSPECTION. AFTER THE SMOKE HAD CLEARED IT WAS THEN BROUGHT INSIDE AND PUT IN THE HAZMAT CAGE UNDER THE VENT HOOD AND INSPECTED. IT WAS FOUND TO BE A DAMAGED UNDECLAIRED HAZMAT. THE HAZMAT PROCESS WAS STARTED. AFTER SPEAKING WITH FXG EMERGENCY TEAM, IT WSA DETERMINDED THAT AN OUTSIDE COMAPANY WOULD COME IN TO DIS POSE OF THE HAZARDOUS CONTENTS. DescribePack: BATTERY WAS CRACKED (POSSIBLY BY FREEZING) CAUSING BATTERY ACID TO LEAK OUT. THAT CAUSED A CHEMICAL REACTION WITH THE FOAM INSULATION INSIDE THE BOX, RESULTING IN IT MELTING AND SMOKING. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: IT WAS PUT IN A HAZMAT TOTE AND SET OUTSIDE FOR VENTILATION. FEDEX EMERGANCY NUMBER WAS CALLED FOR OUTSIDE INSPECTION.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-24T21:07:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-12-21
  • City: MARSHALL
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On December 21, 2022, SET Environmental arrived onsite and observed five (5) gallons of Sodium Bisulfite Solution 40% had been released impacting a 2ft-by-20ft area of trailer floor and a 3ft-by-10ft area of concrete in the terminal parking lot. SET Environmental personnel determined that the poly totes had been overfilled and as a result of cold weather the material expanded and leaked out of the top of the totes. One tote was damaged with a pinhole puncture and the contents of the tote was transferred to a new tote. The other non-damaged tote had a small amount transferred to a new tote to relieve pressure. SET Environmental personnel used soda ash to neutralize the impacted areas and to the leaking totes and then deployed oil dry to impacted areas. The spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum and the damaged tote was broken down and placed into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. All waste and transferred totes were left onsite.

  • Description: XPO Terminal XGR contacted ERTS to report a spill of approximately 20-pounds of UN3349 'Force 6.5G Insecticide" that was released from two 40-pound paper bag during transit due to being improperly loaded into the trailer. The caller stated that the release impacted the trailer floor. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 30-pounds of product released to a 5' x 5' area of the trailer floor due to improper loading. The damaged bags and all released product were collected and containerized into a 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2022110412
item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-24T21:07:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-10-17
  • City: DETROIT
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CONSOLIDATED RAIL CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 17, 2022, at 00:30 hours, Transportation reported that at the Conrail North Yard, Detroit Michigan reported that GATX 90905, a loaded tank car of UN 1778, Fluorsilicic Acid had leaked upon normal switching operations.. Reportedly product blew out of the top valves on the tank car. The tank car was isolated from the crews and employees in the yard. The shipper, JR Simplot, was notified via Chemtrec, report #2022-10-17-00254. Enviroserve, a Conrail emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the North Yard. Enviroserve found that the rupture disk had blown out thus causing the release. After further inspection the tank car was equiped with a salco rupture disk component and found that surge protection was not in place. Additionally the plasteic inspection cap was broken. The shipper representative, Justin Akin, 313-626-2422 was notified of the situation found. Jr Simplot had Rescar replace the Salco rupture disk component and filed One Time Movement Approval #FRA-221110004. This incident did require a special move. NARRI: 5x(5+5+0)x(2+0) = 100 Cause code: 1005

  • Description: XPO Terminal XDE reported a hazardous cargo release. It was reported 50 pound plastic bags of UN 1486 "Ultrasol K Plus" were torn inside the trailer during loading, resulting in product releasing to the trailer floor. ERTS dispatched Hepaco to conduct cleanup operations. At 0857 ET, Hepaco personnel arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 100 pounds of product released to an 8' x 10' area of the dock floor and a 10' x 10' area of the trailer floor. Crew confirmed 36 bags were damaged. All released product was swept up with sodium bicarbonate. The released products, damaged bags, and all impacted debris were collected and containerized into (3) 55 gallon poly drums. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report I-2023010068
item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2023-05-24T21:07:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-08-27
  • City: FIFE LAKE
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: BRENNER OIL COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 1
  • Description: The Brenner Oil Company unit (Tractor/Trailer) was traveling south on US 131 at the speed of 47 MPH. An automobile traveling north on US 131 crossed over the yellow no pass zone lines (i.e., centerline) separating the north from south lanes and hit our unit head-on, causing the Tractor/Trailer to veer right into a guard rail on the southbound side, then veer left into the north guard rail before coming to rest. One of the tractor's saddle tanks was crushed by the car collision, resulting in a diesel fuel spill of approximately 55 gallons. The Tractor Trailer driver used spill control devices to contain the spill to the roadway (absorbent socks, pad, and dirt). Brenner Oil Company contacted Northern A-1 Services (response contractor) immediately, with personnel responding to the site and cleaning up the small spill from the roadway. Other motorists tended to the automobile driver until emergency personnel arrived on scene. Both the Tractor and Automobile were totaled. The driver of the automobile that crossed the centerline died as a result of the collision.

  • Description: At 1424 ET, XPO Terminal XSG called and stated that their delivery driver reported a release at a customer location in Flit, MI. ERTS dispatched First Call Environmental to conduct cleanup. At 1815 ET, First Call personnel arrived onsite and located the damaged cylinder. They opened the valve and let the cylinder complete it's off gassing. The cylinder was being delivered to the site and personnel there stated they would keep the cylinder. No waste was generated.

  • Description: Upon arrival to the consignee location, it was discovered that the container was leaking inside the trailer. The investigation revealed that the drum had a small puncture hole caused by a protruding nail in the skid. The container was immediately turned on it's side to prevent further release of material. Once safely contained the drum was accepted by the customer and placed into another container. Due to the customer being in possession of the container we are unable to provide the packaging specifications.
